abstract: A riverfront showplace near Sioux City, a minimalist condo in Chicago and a 1680 farmhouse outside Providence.
lead_paragraph: Sitting on the shores of the Missouri River, as well as at the edge of an Arnold Palmer-designed golf course, this property is in a 2,000-acre master-planned community with about 1,250 homes, about five miles south of North Sioux City, S.D., and seven miles west of downtown Sioux City, Iowa. (Its location in the extreme southeastern corner of the state also places it near the border of Nebraska.) Interstate 29 runs nearby, with access to major east-west freeways.
